decks.notes: This control deck aims to establish board control by utilizing a mix of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Leyline Binding, and counterspells such as Force of Will. It also focuses on card advantage and disruption through cards like Brainstorm, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Hullbreacher. The deck incorporates a small creature package with Minsc & Boo, Delighted Halfling, and Orcish Bowmasters to provide some early game presence and to pressure the opponent. Additionally, it includes a mix of powerful legendary creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for late-game impact.

The main concept of this deck is focused on control through lands. It utilizes cards like Wasteland, Ghost Quarter, and Maze of Ith to disrupt the opponent's resources and prevent them from executing their game plan effectively. The deck also utilizes cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thespian's Stage to slow down the opponent's spells and make it harder for them to cast multiple spells in a turn. Additionally, the deck uses cards like Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam to generate value and maintain a consistent mana base. The deck also has a combo finish with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to generate a powerful 20/20 creature.

This deck is focused on the combo strategy of Dark Depths, which involves using Thespian's Stage and Vampire Hexmage to create a 20/20 Indestructible Flying creature token. It also includes various land cards that synergize with this combo, such as Dryad Arbor, Karakas, and Sejiri Steppe. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to interact with the opponent's hand, as well as removal cards like Abrupt Decay and Invasion of Ikoria. The deck utilizes a combination of land ramp and discard effects to enable the combo and maintain a strong board presence.

This deck is a 4/5c control deck in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format. The key concept revolves around utilizing a wide range of control elements to maintain dominance over the game. The deck includes powerful control spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, as well as card advantage engines such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Yorion, Sky Nomad. It also incorporates a mix of land destruction with Wasteland and counter spells. Additionally, the deck includes various utility cards like Veil of Summer and Leyline Binding to create a well-rounded and versatile control strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and removal, while also utilizing powerful creatures and ramping mana. The deck includes cards like Natural Order, Snuff Out, and Fiend Artisan to disrupt opponents and remove threats. It also features cards like Gaea's Cradle, Noble Hierarch, and Green Sun's Zenith for ramping and searching for key creatures. The deck aims to maintain board presence and generate advantage through creatures like Elvish Reclaimer, Allosaurus Shepherd, and Grist, the Hunger Tide. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and efficient gameplay to outlast opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to combo off using the Cephalid Breakfast combo. The deck aims to use Nomads en-Kor to redirect damage from creatures to Cephalid Illusionist, which mills the deck to put Narcomoebas into play. This triggers Dread Return, allowing the player to return a creature like Thassa's Oracle and win the game. The deck has a strong control element with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Teferi, Time Raveler. It also includes Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Shuko and Kaldra Compleat. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and options.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies and taking early control of the game. Its key concept revolves around utilizing fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and City of Traitors to quickly play powerful cards like Chalice of the Void and Archon of Emeria. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by limiting their spellcasting abilities. The deck includes a mixture of creatures like Solitude and Caves of Chaos Adventurer for combat power and card advantage, as well as spells like Touch the Spirit Realm and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker for additional control and aggression.

This deck revolves around the powerful combo of Mystic Forge and Paradox Engine. By generating a lot of mana through cards like Crystal Vein, Lotus Petal, and Grim Monolith, the deck aims to cast multiple spells per turn to draw cards and gain card advantage. The key concept is to use artifacts, such as Voltaic Key, Karn, the Great Creator, and Manifold Key, to untap and activate Mystic Forge multiple times in a turn, allowing the player to play cards from the top of their library and potentially win the game with cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong creature presence. It achieves this by utilizing cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Grief to counter or discard the opponent's key cards. Additionally, the deck incorporates efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with threats. The deck also aims to reanimate powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of Orcish Bowmasters and Troll of Khazad-dûm provides a consistent creature presence and additional disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to combine Aggro and Artifact strategies in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on using artifacts, such as Chalice of the Void and Urza's Bauble, to control the game while also utilizing creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Patchwork Automaton to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Petal and Mox Opal allows for fast mana acceleration, allowing the player to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes blue cards like Force of Will for additional control and protection.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the Mystic Forge combo to generate immense card advantage and powerful board presence. The deck features a combination of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Mox Opal, as well as card selection tools like Serum Powder and Echo of Eons to consistently assemble the necessary combo pieces. Key artifacts such as Voltaic Key and Manifold Key allow for additional synergies and the ability to make multiple activations with Mystic Forge. This deck aims to establish a dominant board presence through efficient mana generation and powerful artifact interactions.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive mono black strategy. The deck includes powerful cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Chrome Mox to generate mana quickly and cast threats early in the game. It also features disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a mix of creatures, such as Grief and Troll of Khazad-dûm, to apply pressure, as well as reanimation spells like Reanimate to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence, disrupt the opponent's plays, and close out the game swiftly.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by constantly manipulating the opponent's hand and board state. It utilizes powerful control cards such as Brainstorm, Swords to Plowshares, and Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's resources and options. It also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mystic Sanctuary to further control the game and maintain a favorable board state. Additionally, the deck has access to counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its own game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to use Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library, while also utilizing Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to continuously bring back and utilize artifacts such as Ancient Tomb, Lotus Petal, and Mox Opal. The deck also includes various red color cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The inclusion of Ensnaring Bridge and Orcish Bowmasters provides defense against creature-based strategies, while cards like Fury and Urza's Saga offer additional utility and flexibility in different game scenarios.

This deck focuses on a Cloudpost Ramp strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 format. The key concept revolves around utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith to search for Cloudpost and other important lands. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using Cloudpost and Vesuva, while also having access to powerful utility lands such as Glacial Chasm and Karakas. It also includes several powerful threats like Primeval Titan, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, which can quickly close out the game.
